body:
I have multiple copies of the spack repository cloned and keep stepping on my toes, using the compiler from one tree to build things in the others.

I finally realized that compilers do not have to be personal.  Things still seem to work after moving ~/.spack/compilers.yaml to .../etc/spack/compilers.yaml.

Other than needing to be careful to use the '--scope' flag to `spack compiler add` etc..., am I walking in to something unexpected?
title: I keep being surprised that compilers "global" instead of per-spack tree.
